question.text: The solubility product of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math> is <math><mn>1.8</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup></math>. Precipitation of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math> will occur only when equal volumes of which of the following solutions are mixed?

options.text: <math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo></mrow></msup></math>

solution.text:
After mixing,
Ag+=12 × 10–4=5 × 10–5 M
Cl– =12× 10–4=5 × 10–5 M
Q sp = Ag +   Cl – = 5 ×  10 –5 2 =2.5 ×  10 –9
Since, Q sp > K sp → precipition takes place
